frame.name: Conduct
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> acts in a certain <fen>Manner</fen> either generally or under some particular <fen>Circumstances</fen>. The conduct may also be directed specifically towards an <fen>Affected_party</fen>.
<ex> <fex name="Agent">He</fex> pledges to <t>conduct</t> himself <fex name="Manner">with honesty and humility</fex>.</ex> <ex> This year <fex name="Agent">they</fex> have <t>behaved</t> themselves <fex name="Manner">particularly impudently</fex>.</ex> <ex> His appearance was as immaculate as ever and <fex name="Agent">his</fex> <t>bearing</t> <fex name="Manner">composed and dignified</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that denote the person whose conduct is being evaluated.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Douglas Hurd</fex> <t>carried</t> <t>himself</t> well </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that characterize the way that the <fen>Agent</fen> behaves.
<ex> They stood together and posed for the pass, Alleyne relaxed and smiling , a tall , angular man who <t>carried</t> <t>himself</t> <fex name="Manner">with natural elegance</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate a set of <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the <fen>Agent</fen> acts in a particular way.
<ex>But Garvey did not care what Gabriel believed , so long as he <t>conducted</t> himself <fex name="Circumstances">on stage</fex> like the Angel Gabriel .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Affected_party
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person to whom behavior is directed by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Smithers</fex> <t>behaved</t> himself <fex name="Manner">shamefully</fex> <fex name="Affected_party">towards me</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate why an <fen>Agent</fen> behaved in a certain way.
<ex>People <t>behave</t> in the way they do <fex name="Explanation">because of their past learning experiences</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> behaves in a certain way.
<ex> She knew that she had <t>behaved</t> badly <fex name="tim">last night</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> exhibits their behavior.
<ex>Sometimes an offender may be placed at a Probation hostel because they have committed a serious offence or have <t>behaved</t> badly <fex name="pla">at an independent hostel</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The way in which the Agent behaves in the specified manner.
<ex>He <t>behaved</t> poorly <fex name="Means">by saying rude things</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> of human behavior in which the <fen>Agent</fen> acts in a certain <fen>Manner</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the (usually 'good' or 'bad') conduct of the <fen>Agent</fen> deviates from some standard or norm</def-root>

FE.name: Standard
FE.definition:
<def-root>An explicit point to which the conduct of the <fen>Agent</fen> is compared.
<ex>He <t>carried</t> <t>himself</t> admirably <fex name="Standard">for a teenager</fex>.</ex></def-root>
